title: what is wrong with braum at the moment?
body:
does anyone know why braum has become so useless lately?

I used to love playing him but now every time i try i'm literally the weakest character in every match.
He used to take a lot of damage even without shield, now even with the shield up he dies in less than three seconds.
I pump him full of magic resist or armour depending on what i'm up against but it's almost like i'm not doing that at all, seriously no effect. 
it wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't for the fact that he also can't harm any other character anymore than a fly harms an elephant to add to the problem.
His protect the ally spell does nothing, his r just knocks them up for a bit with about 40 damage, his q which was a good poke just lazily missed most of the time and if it hits it mainly just slows for a bit with 20 damage, as i mentioned the shield does not protect him anymore so it mainly just stops projectiles as the whole team focuses all of their attacks knowing that they'll get an easy kill out of it and get rid of the shield which defeats the purpose. 
If i had level 10 braum hitting a level one jinx for instance, it would take me a minute chipping away to kill her.
That is if she didn't hit back. because she would kill braum in three seconds if she could hit back. 
have they just disabled damage, magic damage, magic resist and armour for him or what?

because thats what if feels like playing him now. 
Used to get at least 10/10/30 sometimes 20/10/50 now every match is 1/20/10 1/10/10 or 2/30/10 every single one, ten times at least in a row. 
thats a big difference and it isn't because i somehow got much worse at the game. 
He's just a completely ineffectual champ now. 
sigh.. 
anyone feel the same?

replies.body:
Maybe try the cheesy Braum top :D

http://i.imgur.com/EqFdt13.jpg

(Full disclosure: I went 1/5 in the next game :P)

I dont know i find when braums played right , agressive and in close quaters from early on making full use of his abilities in combination with his passive during the laning phase he can be extremely potent and can snowball an adc hard. Ive often been lane locked by a good braum.

a ton of braums goodness comes from his he adn the ability to peel damage form priority targets, with runaans and the buff to botrk he takes potentially 3x the damage he would normally take with his shield up, plus the % current hp damage, plus whatever on hit effect they have, plus whatever other % hp damage they have, plus whatever spell the rest of the team is firing for that time, 35% damage reduction is only so much. thasts my opinion anyway.

While I feel there might be more than a touch of exaggeration in your examples...
Ill give my view on this.

Braum is far from ineffectual, infact he is actually quite an asset for a team! 
BUT he is outclassed by the majority of tanky bruisers such as Darius, Renekton or Hecarim, in terms of usefulness to the game. As those champions can absorb just as much _(if not more due to their healing factors)_ damage than Braum can, but unlike Braum, they can dish out almost carry levels of damage. So in an extended fight, champions like Darius and Sion will take home the victory, as they can act just as much of a tank as he can, but also be able to burst down other champions.

So it may seem that you lose extended team fights more often, because once your Ult and shield and passive are down, he becomes only a meatshiled, while the top lane champions are useful throughout the fight AND are a also meatshiled.

So its not that Braum isnt good, its that champions like Darius are TOO good. Thats why he doesn't feel as effective as other tanky non-support champions.

Thats not to say that Braum isn't useful, quite the opposite, a good braum with good team coordination can make sure that the enemy ADC is 100% pointless in a fight, set up your stun and let your ADC freely AA them from the safety of your wall. With todays level of damage output, no ADC should be living after you land your stun on them. a Vayne or Draven will likely kill them before your stun even procs anyway.

Remember that if the enemy is focusing you and killing you first like you say, you are doing your job! Because every ability used on you, is one less that your ADC or Mage has to worry about, and the longer they stay alive, the higher your chance of winning.

______
So no. I don't believe that Braum is a weak champion, I think he is actually quite balanced, but i think it is other tanks _(the ones that deal damage)_ that are too strong, and so make braum look weaker in comparison.
